etymology.description: 手(手) (shǒu, 'hand') depicted as 又(又) (yòu, 'hand') holding a tool -> later stylized to look like 卜(卜) (bǔ, 'divine') -> simplified further
etymology.interpretation: The character 攴 originally depicted a hand holding a tool, possibly implying action such as hitting. Over time, for stylistic reasons, it was modified to resemble the component 卜, even though the phonetic aspect was retained.

examples.chinese: 他用手指攴(他用手指攴)轻叩鼓面(輕叩鼓面)，传递出节奏的信号(傳遞出節奏的信號)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng shǒuzhǐ pū le qīng kòu gǔmiàn, chuándì chū jiézòu de xìnhào.
examples.english: He tapped the drum surface lightly with his finger, conveying the rhythm's signal.

examples.chinese: 她突然攴(她突然攴)了一下门(了一下門)，唤起了室内的安静(喚起了室內的安靜)。
examples.pinyin: Tā túrán pū le yīxià mén, huànqǐ le shìnèi de ānjìng.
examples.english: She suddenly tapped the door, awakening the quiet inside.
